Harris welcomes European Investment Bank proposal to assist in the response to the Refugee Crisis 11.09.15 
Harris welcomes European Investment Bank proposal to assist in the response to the Refugee Crisis 
In advance of today’s (11-Sept-2015) meeting of EU Finance Ministers in Luxembourg, Minister Harris, following a meeting with EIB representatives, welcomed the announcement that the EIB stands ready to assist a common EU response to the refugee crisis that registered a tripling of month-on-month numbers of refugees at EU borders to over 107000 last July. 
Minister Harris noted that, 
“It is a very welcome move that the EIB now stands ready to offer its full range of financial instruments to Ireland, other EU Member States, and beyond the EU in response to the immediate and longer term needs of the Refugee Crisis. This as a strong and clear expression of shared solidarity across our European Union and its institutions.” 
The EIB, as the EU Bank, has stated it is ready to assist in financing basic infrastructure associated with housing and catering to the medical and schooling needs of refugees, and also in terms of supporting initiatives in the areas of education and integration. The proposal also states that the EIB would offer loans at special conditions in order to ensure that no profit is drawn from this human catastrophe. 
Further discussion on this issue has taken place amongst EU Ministers at Ecofin today. 
Minister Harris will continue to represent the Irish Government on behalf of the Minister for Finance at Ecofin and Eurogroup discussions this evening and into tomorrow. 
ENDS
